results.question: How many singers do we have?

results.gen: select count(singer.singer_id) from singer

results.question: Show name, country, age for all singers ordered by age from the oldest to the youngest.
results.gold: select name, country, age from singer order by age desc
results.gen: select name, country, age from singer order by age desc

results.question: What are the names, countries, and ages for every singer in descending order of age?
results.gold: select name, country, age from singer order by age desc
results.gen: select name, country, age from singer order by age desc

results.question: What is the average, minimum, and maximum age of all singers from France?
results.gold: select avg(age), min(age), max(age) from singer where country = 'france'
results.gen: select avg(singer.age) as average_age, min(singer.age) as minimum_age, max(singer.age) as maximum_age from singer where singer.country = 'france'

results.question: What is the average, minimum, and maximum age for all French singers?
results.gold: select avg(age), min(age), max(age) from singer where country = 'france'
results.gen: select avg(singer.age), min(singer.age), max(singer.age) from singer where singer.country = 'french'

results.question: Show the name and the release year of the song by the youngest singer.
results.gold: select song_name, song_release_year from singer order by age limit 1
results.gen: select song_name, song_release_year from singer where age = (select min(age) from singer)

results.question: What are the names and release years for all the songs of the youngest singer?
results.gold: select song_name, song_release_year from singer order by age limit 1
results.gen: select song_name, song_release_year from singer where age = (select min(age) from singer) order by song_release_year

results.question: What are all distinct countries where singers above age 20 are from?
results.gold: select distinct country from singer where age > 20
results.gen: select distinct singer.country from singer where singer.age > 20

results.question: What are  the different countries with singers above age 20?
results.gold: select distinct country from singer where age > 20
results.gen: select distinct country from singer where age > 20

results.question: Show all countries and the number of singers in each country.

results.question: How many singers are from each country?
results.gold: select country, count(*) from singer group by country
results.gen: select singer.country, count(singer.singer_id) from singer group by singer.country

results.question: List all song names by singers above the average age.

results.gen: select song_name from singer where age > (select avg(age) from singer)

results.question: Show location and name for all stadiums with a capacity between 5000 and 10000.
results.gold: select location, name from stadium where capacity between 5000 and 10000

results.gen: select avg(capacity) as average_capacity, max(capacity) as maximum_capacity from stadium

results.question: How many concerts are there in year 2014 or 2015?
results.gold: select count(*) from concert where year = 2014 or year = 2015
results.gen: select count(concert.concert_id) from concert where concert.year in (2014, 2015)

results.question: How many concerts occurred in 2014 or 2015?
results.gold: select count(*) from concert where year = 2014 or year = 2015
results.gen: select count(concert.concert_id) from concert where concert.year in (2014, 2015)

results.question: Show the stadium name and the number of concerts in each stadium.
results.gold: select t2.name, count(*) from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id group by t1.stadium_id
results.gen: select stadium.name, count(concert.concert_id) from stadium left join concert on stadium.stadium_id = concert.stadium_id group by stadium.stadium_id

results.question: For each stadium, how many concerts play there?
results.gold: select t2.name, count(*) from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id group by t1.stadium_id
results.gen: select stadium.name, count(distinct concert.concert_id) from stadium left join concert on stadium.stadium_id = concert.stadium_id group by stadium.stadium_id, stadium.name

results.question: Show the stadium name and capacity with most number of concerts in year 2014 or after.
results.gold: select t2.name, t2.capacity from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id where t1.year >= 2014 group by t2.stadium_id order by count(*) desc limit 1
results.gen: select stadium.name, stadium.capacity from concert join stadium on concert.stadium_id = stadium.stadium_id where concert.year >= 2014 group by concert.stadium_id, stadium.name, stadium.capacity order by count(concert.concert_id) desc limit 1

results.question: What is the name and capacity of the stadium with the most concerts after 2013 ?
results.gold: select t2.name, t2.capacity from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id where t1.year > 2013 group by t2.stadium_id order by count(*) desc limit 1
results.gen: select stadium.name, stadium.capacity from concert join stadium on concert.stadium_id = stadium.stadium_id where concert.year > 2013 group by concert.stadium_id, stadium.name, stadium.capacity order by count(concert.concert_id) desc limit 1

results.question: Which year has most number of concerts?
results.gold: select year from concert group by year order by count(*) desc limit 1
results.gen: select year, count(concert_id) as concert_count from concert group by year having count(concert_id) = ( select max(cnt) from ( select count(concert_id) as cnt from concert group by year ) as counts ) order by year

results.question: What is the year that had the most concerts?
results.gold: select year from concert group by year order by count(*) desc limit 1
results.gen: select year from concert group by year order by count(concert_id) desc limit 1

results.question: Show the stadium names without any concert.
results.gold: select name from stadium where stadium_id not in (select stadium_id from concert)
results.gen: select stadium.name from stadium left join concert on stadium.stadium_id = concert.stadium_id where concert.concert_id is null

results.question: What are the names of the stadiums without any concerts?
results.gold: select name from stadium where stadium_id not in (select stadium_id from concert)
results.gen: select stadium.name from stadium left join concert on stadium.stadium_id = concert.stadium_id where concert.concert_id is null

results.question: Show countries where a singer above age 40 and a singer below 30 are from.
results.gold: select country from singer where age > 40 intersect select country from singer where age < 30
results.gen: select singer.country from singer join singer_in_concert on singer.singer_id = singer_in_concert.singer_id join concert on singer_in_concert.concert_id = concert.concert_id where singer.age > 40 intersect select singer.country from singer where singer.age < 30

results.question: Show names for all stadiums except for stadiums having a concert in year 2014.
results.gold: select name from stadium except select t2.name from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id where t1.year = 2014
results.gen: select stadium.name from stadium left join concert on stadium.stadium_id = concert.stadium_id and concert.year = 2014 where concert.concert_id is null

results.question: What are the names of all stadiums that did not have a concert in 2014?
results.gold: select name from stadium except select t2.name from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id where t1.year = 2014
results.gen: select stadium.name from stadium left join concert on stadium.stadium_id = concert.stadium_id and concert.year = 2014 where concert.concert_id is null

results.question: Show the name and theme for all concerts and the number of singers in each concert.
results.gold: select t2.concert_name, t2.theme, count(*) from singer_in_concert as t1 join concert as t2 on t1.concert_id = t2.concert_id group by t2.concert_id
results.gen: select concert.concert_name, concert.theme, count(singer.singer_id) from concert left join singer_in_concert on concert.concert_id = singer_in_concert.concert_id left join singer on singer_in_concert.singer_id = singer.singer_id group by concert.concert_id, concert.concert_name, concert.theme

results.question: What are the names , themes , and number of singers for every concert ?
results.gold: select t2.concert_name, t2.theme, count(*) from singer_in_concert as t1 join concert as t2 on t1.concert_id = t2.concert_id group by t2.concert_id
results.gen: select concert.concert_name, concert.theme, count(singer_in_concert.singer_id) from concert join singer_in_concert on concert.concert_id = singer_in_concert.concert_id group by concert.concert_id, concert.concert_name, concert.theme

results.question: List singer names and number of concerts for each singer.
results.gold: select t2.name, count(*) from singer_in_concert as t1 join singer as t2 on t1.singer_id = t2.singer_id group by t2.singer_id
results.gen: select singer.name, count(singer_in_concert.concert_id) as number_of_concerts from singer join singer_in_concert on singer.singer_id = singer_in_concert.singer_id join concert on singer_in_concert.concert_id = concert.concert_id group by singer.singer_id, singer.name

results.question: What are the names of the singers and number of concerts for each person?
results.gold: select t2.name, count(*) from singer_in_concert as t1 join singer as t2 on t1.singer_id = t2.singer_id group by t2.singer_id
results.gen: select singer.name, count(concert.concert_id) from singer join singer_in_concert on singer.singer_id = singer_in_concert.singer_id join concert on singer_in_concert.concert_id = concert.concert_id group by singer.singer_id, singer.name

results.question: List all singer names in concerts in year 2014.
results.gold: select t2.name from singer_in_concert as t1 join singer as t2 on t1.singer_id = t2.singer_id join concert as t3 on t1.concert_id = t3.concert_id where t3.year = 2014
results.gen: select singer.name from singer_in_concert join singer on singer_in_concert.singer_id = singer.singer_id join concert on singer_in_concert.concert_id = concert.concert_id where concert.year = 2014

results.question: What are the names of the singers who performed in a concert in 2014?
results.gold: select t2.name from singer_in_concert as t1 join singer as t2 on t1.singer_id = t2.singer_id join concert as t3 on t1.concert_id = t3.concert_id where t3.year = 2014
results.gen: select singer.name from concert join singer_in_concert on concert.concert_id = singer_in_concert.concert_id join singer on singer_in_concert.singer_id = singer.singer_id where concert.year = 2014

results.question: what is the name and nation of the singer who have a song having 'Hey' in its name?
results.gold: select name, country from singer where song_name like '%hey%'
results.gen: select name, country from singer where song_name like '%hey%'

results.question: What is the name and country of origin of every singer who has a song with the word 'Hey' in its title?
results.gold: select name, country from singer where song_name like '%hey%'
results.gen: select name, country from singer where song_name like '%hey%'

results.question: Find the name and location of the stadiums which some concerts happened in the years of both 2014 and 2015.
results.gold: select t2.name, t2.location from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id where t1.year = 2014 intersect select t2.name, t2.location from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id where t1.year = 2015
results.gen: select distinct s.name, s.location from stadium s join concert c2014 on s.stadium_id = c2014.stadium_id and c2014.year = 2014 join concert c2015 on s.stadium_id = c2015.stadium_id and c2015.year = 2015

results.question: What are the names and locations of the stadiums that had concerts that occurred in both 2014 and 2015?
results.gold: select t2.name, t2.location from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id where t1.year = 2014 intersect select t2.name, t2.location from concert as t1 join stadium as t2 on t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id where t1.year = 2015
results.gen: select stadium.name, stadium.location from stadium where stadium.stadium_id in ( select distinct stadium.stadium_id from concert join stadium on concert.stadium_id = stadium.stadium_id where concert.year = 2014 intersect select distinct stadium.stadium_id from concert join stadium on concert.stadium_id = stadium.stadium_id where concert.year = 2015 )

results.question: Find the number of concerts happened in the stadium with the highest capacity .
results.gold: select count(*) from concert where stadium_id = (select stadium_id from stadium order by capacity desc limit 1)
results.gen: select count(c.concert_id) from concert c join stadium s on c.stadium_id = s.stadium_id where s.capacity = (select max(capacity) from stadium)

results.question: What are the number of concerts that occurred in the stadium with the largest capacity ?
results.gold: select count(*) from concert where stadium_id = (select stadium_id from stadium order by capacity desc limit 1)
results.gen: select count(concert.concert_id) from stadium join concert on stadium.stadium_id = concert.stadium_id where stadium.capacity = (select max(capacity) from stadium)

results.question: Find the number of pets whose weight is heavier than 10.
results.gold: select count(*) from pets where weight > 10
results.gen: select count(pets.petid) from pets where pets.weight > 10

results.question: How many pets have a greater weight than 10?
results.gold: select count(*) from pets where weight > 10
results.gen: select count(pets.petid) from pets where pets.weight > 10

results.question: Find the weight of the youngest dog.
results.gold: select weight from pets order by pet_age limit 1
results.gen: select pets.weight from pets order by pets.pet_age asc limit 1

results.question: How much does the youngest dog weigh?
results.gold: select weight from pets order by pet_age limit 1
results.gen: select pets.weight from pets join has_pet on pets.petid = has_pet.petid join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid where pets.pettype = 'dog' order by pets.pet_age asc limit 1

results.question: Find the maximum weight for each type of pet. List the maximum weight and pet type.
results.gold: select max(weight), pettype from pets group by pettype
results.gen: select pets.pettype, max(pets.weight) as maxweight from pets join has_pet on pets.petid = has_pet.petid join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid group by pets.pettype

results.question: List the maximum weight and type for each type of pet.
results.gold: select max(weight), pettype from pets group by pettype
results.gen: select pettype, max(weight) as maximum_weight from pet group by pettype

results.question: Find number of pets owned by students who are older than 20.
results.gold: select count(*) from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid where t1.age > 20
results.gen: select count(pets.petid) from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where student.age > 20

results.question: How many pets are owned by students that have an age greater than 20?
results.gold: select count(*) from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid where t1.age > 20
results.gen: select count(*) from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where student.age > 20

results.question: Find the number of dog pets that are raised by female students (with sex F).
results.gold: select count(*) from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t2.petid = t3.petid where t1.sex = 'f' and t3.pettype = 'dog'
results.gen: select count(pets.petid) from pets join has_pet on pets.petid = has_pet.petid join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid where pets.pettype = 'dog' and student.sex = 'f'

results.question: How many dog pets are raised by female students?
results.gold: select count(*) from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t2.petid = t3.petid where t1.sex = 'f' and t3.pettype = 'dog'
results.gen: select count(distinct student.stuid) from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where student.sex = 'female' and pets.pettype = 'dog'

results.question: Find the number of distinct type of pets.
results.gold: select count(distinct pettype) from pets
results.gen: select count(distinct pettype) from pets

results.question: How many different types of pet are there?
results.gold: select count(distinct pettype) from pets
results.gen: select count(distinct pettype) from pets

results.question: Find the first name of students who have cat or dog pet.
results.gold: select distinct t1.fname from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat' or t3.pettype = 'dog'
results.gen: select distinct student.fname from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where pets.pettype in ('cat', 'dog')

results.question: What are the first names of every student who has a cat or dog as a pet?
results.gold: select distinct t1.fname from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat' or t3.pettype = 'dog'
results.gen: select distinct student.fname from pets join has_pet on pets.petid = has_pet.petid join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid where pets.pettype in ('cat', 'dog')

results.question: Find the first name of students who have both cat and dog pets .
results.gold: select t1.fname from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat' intersect select t1.fname from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'dog'
results.gen: select student.fname from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where pets.pettype = 'cat' intersect select student.fname from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where pets.pettype = 'dog'

results.question: What are the students' first names who have both cats and dogs as pets?
results.gold: select t1.fname from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat' intersect select t1.fname from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'dog'
results.gen: select student.fname from has_pet join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid where pets.pettype in ('cat', 'dog') group by student.stuid, student.fname having count(distinct case when pets.pettype = 'cat' then 1 end) > 0 and count(distinct case when pets.pettype = 'dog' then 1 end) > 0

results.question: Find the major and age of students who do not have a cat pet.
results.gold: select major, age from student where stuid not in (select t1.stuid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat')
results.gen: select student.major, student.age from student where student.stuid not in (select student.stuid from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where pets.pettype = 'cat')

results.question: What major is every student who does not own a cat as a pet, and also how old are they?
results.gold: select major, age from student where stuid not in (select t1.stuid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat')
results.gen: select student.major, student.age from student where student.stuid not in (select has_pet.stuid from has_pet join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where pets.pettype = 'cat')

results.question: Find the id of students who do not have a cat pet.
results.gold: select stuid from student except select t1.stuid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat'
results.gen: select s.stuid from student s where not exists ( select 1 from has_pet hp join pets p on hp.petid = p.petid where hp.stuid = s.stuid and p.pettype = 'cat' )

results.question: What are the ids of the students who do not own cats as pets?
results.gold: select stuid from student except select t1.stuid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat'
results.gen: select stuid from student where stuid not in (select distinct has_pet.stuid from pets join has_pet on pets.petid = has_pet.petid where pets.pettype = 'cat')

results.question: Find the first name and age of students who have a dog but do not have a cat as a pet.
results.gold: select t1.fname, t1.age from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'dog' and t1.stuid not in (select t1.stuid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat')
results.gen: select s.fname, s.age from student s where exists ( select 1 from has_pet hp join pets p on hp.petid = p.petid where hp.stuid = s.stuid and p.pettype = 'dog' ) and not exists ( select 1 from has_pet hp join pets p on hp.petid = p.petid where hp.stuid = s.stuid and p.pettype = 'cat' )

results.question: What is the first name of every student who has a dog but does not have a cat?
results.gold: select t1.fname, t1.age from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'dog' and t1.stuid not in (select t1.stuid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pettype = 'cat')
results.gen: select s.fname from student s where s.stuid in ( select hp.stuid from has_pet hp join pets p on hp.petid = p.petid where p.pettype = 'dog' except select hp.stuid from has_pet hp join pets p on hp.petid = p.petid where p.pettype = 'cat' )

results.question: Find the first name and age of students who have a pet.
results.gold: select distinct t1.fname, t1.age from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid
results.gen: select student.fname, student.age from student where exists (select 1 from has_pet where has_pet.stuid = student.stuid)

results.question: What are the different first names and ages of the students who do have pets?
results.gold: select distinct t1.fname, t1.age from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid
results.gen: select distinct student.fname, student.age from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid

results.question: Find the id of the pet owned by student whose last name is ‘Smith’.
results.gold: select t2.petid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid where t1.lname = 'smith'
results.gen: select pets.petid from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where student.lname = 'smith'

results.question: What is the id of the pet owned by the student whose last name is 'Smith'?
results.gold: select t2.petid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid where t1.lname = 'smith'
results.gen: select pets.petid from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid where student.lname = 'smith'

results.question: Find the number of pets for each student who has any pet and student id.
results.gold: select count(*), t1.stuid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid group by t1.stuid
results.gen: select student.stuid, count(pets.petid) from student join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid group by student.stuid

results.question: For students who have pets , how many pets does each student have ? list their ids instead of names .
results.gold: select count(*), t1.stuid from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid group by t1.stuid
results.gen: select has_pet.stuid, count(pets.petid) from has_pet join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid join pets on has_pet.petid = pets.petid group by has_pet.stuid

results.question: Find the first name and gender of student who have more than one pet.
results.gold: select t1.fname, t1.sex from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid group by t1.stuid having count(*) > 1
results.gen: select student.fname, student.sex from has_pet join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid group by has_pet.stuid, student.fname, student.sex having count(has_pet.petid) > 1

results.question: What is the first name and gender of the all the students who have more than one pet?
results.gold: select t1.fname, t1.sex from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid group by t1.stuid having count(*) > 1
results.gen: select student.fname, student.sex from has_pet join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid group by has_pet.stuid having count(has_pet.petid) > 1

results.question: Find the last name of the student who has a cat that is age 3.
results.gold: select t1.lname from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pet_age = 3 and t3.pettype = 'cat'
results.gen: select student.lname from pets join has_pet on pets.petid = has_pet.petid join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid where pets.pettype = 'cat' and pets.pet_age = 3

results.question: What is the last name of the student who has a cat that is 3 years old?
results.gold: select t1.lname from student as t1 join has_pet as t2 on t1.stuid = t2.stuid join pets as t3 on t3.petid = t2.petid where t3.pet_age = 3 and t3.pettype = 'cat'
results.gen: select student.lname from pets join has_pet on pets.petid = has_pet.petid join student on has_pet.stuid = student.stuid where pets.pet_age = 3

results.question: Find the average age of students who do not have any pet .
results.gold: select avg(age) from student where stuid not in (select stuid from has_pet)
results.gen: select avg(student.age) from student left join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid where has_pet.stuid is null

results.question: What is the average age for all students who do not own any pets ?
results.gold: select avg(age) from student where stuid not in (select stuid from has_pet)
results.gen: select avg(student.age) from student left join has_pet on student.stuid = has_pet.stuid where has_pet.stuid is null

results.question: How many continents are there?
results.gold: select count(*) from continents
results.gen: select count(distinct continent) from continents

results.question: What is the number of continents?
results.gold: select count(*) from continents
results.gen: select count(distinct continents.continent) from continents

results.question: How many countries does each continent have? List the continent id, continent name and the number of countries.
results.gold: select t1.contid, t1.continent, count(*) from continents as t1 join countries as t2 on t1.contid = t2.continent group by t1.contid
results.gen: select continents.contid, continents.continent, count(countries.countryid) from continents join countries on continents.contid = countries.continent group by continents.contid, continents.continent

results.question: For each continent, list its id, name, and how many countries it has?
results.gold: select t1.contid, t1.continent, count(*) from continents as t1 join countries as t2 on t1.contid = t2.continent group by t1.contid
results.gen: select continents.contid, continents.continent, count(countries.countryid) from continents left join countries on continents.contid = countries.continent group by continents.contid, continents.continent

results.question: How many countries are listed?
results.gold: select count(*) from countries
results.gen: select count(distinct countryid) from countries

results.question: How many countries exist?
results.gold: select count(*) from countries
results.gen: select count(distinct countryid) from countries

results.question: How many models does each car maker produce? List maker full name, id and the number.
results.gold: select t1.fullname, t1.id, count(*) from car_makers as t1 join model_list as t2 on t1.id = t2.maker group by t1.id
results.gen: select car_makers.fullname, car_makers.id, count(model_list.modelid) from car_makers join model_list on car_makers.id = model_list.maker group by car_makers.id, car_makers.fullname

results.question: What is the full name of each car maker, along with its id and how many models it produces?
results.gold: select t1.fullname, t1.id, count(*) from car_makers as t1 join model_list as t2 on t1.id = t2.maker group by t1.id
results.gen: select car_makers.id, car_makers.fullname, count(model_list.modelid) from car_makers join model_list on car_makers.id = model_list.maker group by car_makers.id, car_makers.fullname

results.question: Which model of the car has the minimum horsepower?
results.gold: select t1.model from car_names as t1 join cars_data as t2 on t1.makeid = t2.id order by t2.horsepower asc limit 1
results.gen: select model_list.model from cars_data join car_names on cars_data.id = car_names.makeid join model_list on car_names.model = model_list.model where cars_data.horsepower = (select min(horsepower) from cars_data)

results.question: What is the model of the car with the smallest amount of horsepower?
results.gold: select t1.model from car_names as t1 join cars_data as t2 on t1.makeid = t2.id order by t2.horsepower asc limit 1
results.gen: select model_list.model from cars_data join car_names on cars_data.id = car_names.makeid join model_list on car_names.model = model_list.model order by cars_data.horsepower asc limit 1

results.question: Find the model of the car whose weight is below the average weight.
results.gold: select t1.model from car_names as t1 join cars_data as t2 on t1.makeid = t2.id where t2.weight < (select avg(weight) from cars_data)
results.gen: select car_names.model from cars_data join car_names on cars_data.id = car_names.makeid where cars_data.weight < (select avg(weight) from cars_data)

results.question: What is the model for the car with a weight smaller than the average?
results.gold: select t1.model from car_names as t1 join cars_data as t2 on t1.makeid = t2.id where t2.weight < (select avg(weight) from cars_data)
results.gen: select model_list.model from cars_data join car_names on car_names.makeid = cars_data.id join model_list on car_names.model = model_list.model where cars_data.weight < (select avg(weight) from cars_data)

results.question: Find the name of the makers that produced some cars in the year of 1970?
results.gold: select distinct t1.maker from car_makers as t1 join model_list as t2 on t1.id = t2.maker join car_names as t3 on t2.model = t3.model join cars_data as t4 on t3.makeid = t4.id where t4.year = '1970'
results.gen: select distinct car_makers.maker from cars_data join car_names on cars_data.id = car_names.makeid join model_list on car_names.model = model_list.model join car_makers on model_list.maker = car_makers.id where cars_data.year = 1970
